Her research investigates ways in which animals can interact with and control computer systems, while designing and building new methods to facilitate and evaluate such interactions. Over the past decade, Hirskyj-Douglas has led research to design and develop of novel computer systems, enabling animals to control their environment and access the internet in an ethically focused manner that prioritises their well-being and agency. Her work has opened new possibilities for animals to connect and communicate with humans and other animals in new, unprecedented ways.
